title: Gridders hit turf tonight
text:
mtupa@examiner-enterprise.com 
All the talking, planning, sweating, pain of preparation and dreaming is done. 
Tonight is the time for area high school football teams to get it done as they surge onto the turf for their Week 6 tilts. 
For many — including Dewey, the Caney Valley Trojans, Barnsdall, Oklahoma Union, Copan and Pawhuska — tonight’s contests represent must-win opportunities if these programs are to realistically remain in the chase for an OSSAA playoff berth. 
For others — such as Bartlesville and Nowata — tonight’s showdowns offer a golden chance to solidify their spots at the top of their respective districts. 
Few games in Class 6A-II will garner more attention then the collision in Bartlesville between the Bruins and the Muskogee Roughers, set to kick off at 7 p.m. at Custer Stadium. 
Both teams are 2-0 in District 6A-II-1, and Bartlesville is riding the crest of a perfect (5-0) record for the season. 
Dewey (1-4) travels to Kellyville (1-4), with survival in the District 2A-8 playoff race on the line. 
The Caney Valley Trojans (0-5) play at Oklahoma Union (0-5), in what may be the last chance for the winner to stay in the chase for the postseason. 
Nowata (4-2) goes to Chelsea (2-3), in a scrap between unbeaten teams in 2A-8 play. 
Barnsdall (2-3) faces a must-win scenario at Mounds (2-3). 
Copan (0-5) will be battling against visiting Prue (0-5) for its first win. 
Pawhuska (1-4) will look to upset Wyandotte (3-2), in 2A-8 action. 
Wesleyan Christian (2-4) will host Garber in non-OSSAA play. 
And, the Caney Valley (Kan.) boys visit Cherryvale. Rules for posting comments
